title.value: Performance of generative pre-trained transformers (GPTs) in Certification Examination of the College of Family Physicians of Canada
title.justification: The paper assesses the performance of generative pre-trained transformers (GPTs) like GPT-3.5 and GPT-4 in the CFPC examination context.
title.quote: Performance of generative pre-trained transformers (GPTs) in Certification Examination of the College of Family Physicians of Canada.

extractions.description: This research paper examines the performance and accuracy of generative pre-trained transformers (GPT-3.5 and GPT-4) in answering sample questions from the Certification Examination of the College of Family Physicians of Canada (CFPC). The study conducts multiple rounds of tests and analyses the results to compare the effectiveness of the two models in providing accurate and helpful responses in the context of medical examination preparation.

type.justification: The study involves empirical testing and evaluation of GPT-3.5 and GPT-4's performances based on scores derived from sample CFPC exam questions, which constitutes an empirical research approach.
type.quote: This study aims to assess the performance of GPTs in responding to a set of sample questions of short-answer management problems (SAMPs) from the certification exam of the College of Family Physicians of Canada (CFPC).

name.justification: The paper focuses on the application of AI, specifically generative pre-trained transformers, in medical education, particularly assessing medical exams.
name.quote: The application of large language models such as generative pre-trained transformers (GPTs) has been promising in medical education, and its performance has been tested for different medical exams.

name.justification: The study is based on large language models, which are central to the natural language processing field.
name.quote: ChatGPT, released by Open AI (San Francisco, California, USA) in November 2022, is an advanced large language model (LLM).

name.justification: The research assesses the performance of AI models in the context of medical examinations.
name.quote: This study aims to assess the performance of GPTs in responding to a set of sample questions.

name.justification: The study uses GPT-3.5 to evaluate its performance on CFPC exam questions.
name.quote: We used GPT-3.5 and GPT-4 in five rounds to answer a sample of 77 SAMPs questions from the CFPC website.

is_contributed.justification: GPT-3.5 is used as an external model for testing and not a contribution of this research.
is_contributed.quote: This study aims to assess the performance of GPTs...

is_executed.justification: GPT-3.5 was actively used to respond to questions in this study.
is_executed.quote: We used GPT-3.5 and GPT-4 in five rounds to answer a sample of 77 SAMPs questions.

is_compared.justification: The performance of GPT-3.5 is numerically compared with GPT-4.
is_compared.quote: The likelihood of achieving a higher CFPC Score Percentage for GPT-4 was 2.31 times more than GPT-3.5.

referenced_paper_title.value: Capabilities of Gpt-4 on medical challenge problems
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper discusses the capabilities of GPT-3.5, considering it in context with medical problems to illustrate its performance.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ChatGPT, by default, uses the generative pre-trained transformer (GPT) 3.5 model.

name.justification: The study uses GPT-4 to evaluate its performance on CFPC exam questions compared to GPT-3.5.
name.quote: We used GPT-3.5 and GPT-4 in five rounds to answer a sample of 77 SAMPs questions from the CFPC website.

is_contributed.justification: GPT-4 is used as an external model for testing and not a contribution of this research.
is_contributed.quote: This study aims to assess the performance of GPTs...

is_executed.justification: GPT-4 was actively used to respond to questions in this study.
is_executed.quote: We used GPT-3.5 and GPT-4 in five rounds to answer a sample of 77 SAMPs questions.

is_compared.justification: The performance of GPT-4 is numerically compared with GPT-3.5.
is_compared.quote: The likelihood of achieving a higher CFPC Score Percentage for GPT-4 was 2.31 times more than GPT-3.5.

referenced_paper_title.value: Capabilities of Gpt-4 on medical challenge problems
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper discusses the capabilities of GPT-4, considering it in context with medical problems to illustrate its performance.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In contrast, ChatGPT Plus uses GPT-4.0, which is claimed to be a more accurate and efficient tool with improved and safer responses to complex problems.

name.justification: The dataset of CFPC exam questions was used to evaluate the performance of GPT-3.5 and GPT-4.
name.quote: We used a sample set of SAMPs obtained from the official website of the CFPC.

referenced_paper_title.value: Capabilities of Gpt-4 on medical challenge problems
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper discusses the context and use of CFPC related exam questions for evaluation purposes.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We conducted this study using all the questions from a sample set of SAMPs obtained from the official website of the CFPC.

name.justification: SPSS software was explicitly mentioned as being used for statistical analysis in the study.
name.quote: We conducted our statistical analyses using SPSS V.16.0 software (SPSS Inc, Chicago, Illinois, USA).

aliases: Statistical Package for the Social Sciences

referenced_paper_title.value: Capabilities of Gpt-4 on medical challenge problems
referenced_paper_title.justification: SPSS as a tool was used in the methodology for analysis which can be cross-referenced for similar types of studies.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We conducted our statistical analyses using SPSS V.16.0 software.
